description: Creates a snapshot of a DB instance. The source DB instance must be in the available or storage-optimization state.

parameters.name: DBSnapshotIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier for the DB snapshot. Constraints: Can't be null, empty, or blank Must contain from 1 to 255 letters, numbers, or hyphens First character must be a letter Can't end with a hyphen or contain two consecutive hyphens Example: my-snapshot-id.

parameters.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
parameters.description: The identifier of the DB instance that you want to create the snapshot of. Constraints: Must match the identifier of an existing DBInstance.

parameters.name: Tags
parameters.description: A list of tags. For more information, see Tagging Amazon RDS resources in the Amazon RDS User Guide or Tagging Amazon Aurora and Amazon RDS resources in the Amazon Aurora User Guide. (dict) --- Metadata assigned to an Amazon RDS resource consisting of a key-value pair. Key (string) --- A key is the required name of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with aws: or rds:. The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --:', --/', --=', --+', ---', --@' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-@]*)$'). Value (string) --- A value is the optional value of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with aws: or rds:. The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --:', --/', --=', --+', ---', --@' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-@]*)$').

nested_params.name: Key
nested_params.description: A key is the required name of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with aws: or rds:. The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --:', --/', --=', --+', ---', --@' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-@]*)$').

nested_params.name: Value
nested_params.description: A value is the optional value of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with aws: or rds:. The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --:', --/', --=', --+', ---', --@' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-@]*)$').

nested_items.name: DBSnapshot
nested_items.description: Contains the details of an Amazon RDS DB snapshot.

nested_items.name: DBSnapshotIdentifier
nested_items.description: Specifies the identifier for the DB snapshot.

nested_items.name: DBInstanceIdentifier
nested_items.description: Specifies the DB instance identifier of the DB instance this DB snapshot was created from.

nested_items.name: SnapshotCreateTime
nested_items.description: Specifies when the snapshot was taken in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Changes for the copy when the snapshot is copied.

nested_items.name: Engine
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the database engine.

nested_items.name: AllocatedStorage
nested_items.description: Specifies the allocated storage size in gibibytes (GiB).

nested_items.name: Status
nested_items.description: Specifies the status of this DB snapshot.

nested_items.name: Port
nested_items.description: Specifies the port that the database engine was listening on at the time of the snapshot.

nested_items.name: AvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the Availability Zone the DB instance was located in at the time of the DB snapshot.

nested_items.name: VpcId
nested_items.description: Provides the VPC ID associated with the DB snapshot.

nested_items.name: InstanceCreateTime
nested_items.description: Specifies the time in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC) when the DB instance, from which the snapshot was taken, was created.

nested_items.name: MasterUsername
nested_items.description: Provides the master username for the DB snapshot.

nested_items.name: EngineVersion
nested_items.description: Specifies the version of the database engine.

nested_items.name: LicenseModel
nested_items.description: License model information for the restored DB instance.

nested_items.name: SnapshotType
nested_items.description: Provides the type of the DB snapshot.

nested_items.name: Iops
nested_items.description: Specifies the Provisioned IOPS (I/O operations per second) value of the DB instance at the time of the snapshot.

nested_items.name: OptionGroupName
nested_items.description: Provides the option group name for the DB snapshot.

nested_items.name: PercentProgress
nested_items.description: The percentage of the estimated data that has been transferred.

nested_items.name: SourceRegion
nested_items.description: The Amazon Web Services Region that the DB snapshot was created in or copied from.

nested_items.name: SourceDBSnapshotIdentifier
nested_items.description: The DB snapshot Amazon Resource Name (ARN) that the DB snapshot was copied from. It only has a value in the case of a cross-account or cross-Region copy.

nested_items.name: StorageType
nested_items.description: Specifies the storage type associated with DB snapshot.

nested_items.name: TdeCredentialArn
nested_items.description: The ARN from the key store with which to associate the instance for TDE encryption.

nested_items.name: Encrypted
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB snapshot is encrypted.

nested_items.name: KmsKeyId
nested_items.description: If Encrypted is true, the Amazon Web Services KMS key identifier for the encrypted DB snapshot.

nested_items.name: DBSnapshotArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) for the DB snapshot.

nested_items.name: Timezone
nested_items.description: The time zone of the DB snapshot. In most cases, the Timezone element is empty. Timezone content appears only for snapshots taken from Microsoft SQL Server DB instances that were created with a time zone specified.

nested_items.name: IAMDatabaseAuthenticationEnabled
nested_items.description: Indicates whether mapping of Amazon Web Services Identity and Access Management (IAM) accounts to database accounts is enabled.

nested_items.name: ProcessorFeatures
nested_items.description: The number of CPU cores and the number of threads per core for the DB instance class of the DB instance when the DB snapshot was created.
CreateDBInstance.
ModifyDBInstance.
RestoreDBInstanceFromDBSnapshot.
RestoreDBInstanceFromS3
RestoreDBInstanceToPointInTime.

nested_items.name: DbiResourceId
nested_items.description: The identifier for the source DB instance, which can't be changed and which is unique to an Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: TagList
nested_items.description: A list of tags.

nested_items.name: Key
nested_items.description: A key is the required name of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 128 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with aws: or rds:. The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --:', --/', --=', --+', ---', --@' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-@]*)$').

nested_items.name: Value
nested_items.description: A value is the optional value of the tag. The string value can be from 1 to 256 Unicode characters in length and can't be prefixed with aws: or rds:. The string can only contain only the set of Unicode letters, digits, white-space, --_', --.', --:', --/', --=', --+', ---', --@' (Java regex: '^([\p{L}\p{Z}\p{N}_.:/=+\-@]*)$').

nested_items.name: OriginalSnapshotCreateTime
nested_items.description: Specifies the time of the CreateDBSnapshot operation in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC). Doesn't change when the snapshot is copied.

nested_items.name: SnapshotDatabaseTime
nested_items.description: The timestamp of the most recent transaction applied to the database that you're backing up. Thus, if you restore a snapshot, SnapshotDatabaseTime is the most recent transaction in the restored DB instance. In contrast, originalSnapshotCreateTime specifies the system time that the snapshot completed.

nested_items.name: SnapshotTarget
nested_items.description: Specifies where manual snapshots are stored: Dedicated Local Zones, Amazon Web Services Outposts or the Amazon Web Services Region.

nested_items.name: StorageThroughput
nested_items.description: Specifies the storage throughput for the DB snapshot.

nested_items.name: DBSystemId
nested_items.description: The Oracle system identifier (SID), which is the name of the Oracle database instance that manages your database files. The Oracle SID is also the name of your CDB.

nested_items.name: DedicatedLogVolume
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the DB instance has a dedicated log volume (DLV) enabled.

nested_items.name: MultiTenant
nested_items.description: Indicates whether the snapshot is of a DB instance using the multi-tenant configuration (TRUE) or the single-tenant configuration (FALSE).

nested_items.name: SnapshotAvailabilityZone
nested_items.description: Specifies the name of the Availability Zone where RDS stores the DB snapshot. This value is valid only for snapshots that RDS stores on a Dedicated Local Zone.
